body.p:
Louisville Ky
JunJuly, 8, 1861.
My Dear Ann

I have been run nearly to death since I got here, and have time now only to write you a few lines -- I think for several reasons for my sons, myself and our cause that I had better go on with them to Richmond, from which I can return in a very short time. Rest assured I shall be in no danger what ever --

My Dear Anne, I hope you will improve the time of my absence, to renovate yourself, by cheerful excrcis -- and enjoyment with your Friends -- Stay a great deal with Eliza. Now ^must^ my remind my little boys of me daily, and may God aAlmighty, bless and preserve you

Yours affectionate
Husband.
George W Johnson
I will arrange to write you from Richmond
